BaseMods.MiscDesc: Adds automatic [SUCCESS] to all Perception checks made by the user to spot and gather evidence.
Provides benefits of breath mask and respirator.
Suffer 2 strain to decrease difficulty of Computers check to disable security or slice a computer by one.
When piloting vehicle with linked control device, may use Coordination skill instead of Piloting skill.
Provides [ADVANTAGE] on Gunnery and Ranged-Heavy checks.
Counts as a Brawl weapon
Gain [BOOST] to Deception checks when gambling.
Gain [BOOST][BOOST] to Deception checks when gambling.
Removing requires Daunting ([DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY]) Skulduggery check. Failure causes 2 strain, 1 wound, and disorients for 5 rounds.
Removing requires Daunting ([DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY]) Skulduggery check. Failure causes 10 wound to each character in engaged range.

Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Resilience Check. Fail: Inflicts 1 strain, 3 strain next turn, 5 strain turn after that. Suffer [SETBACK] on all checks. Each [THREAT] inflicts 1 more strain. [DESPAIR]: Make another check on third turn or suffer 5 more strain.
Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) (1 dose) or Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) (2+ doses) Resilience Check. Fail: Inflicts 5 wound. Each [THREAT] inflicts 2 strain. Lasts 3 rounds.
Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Resilience Check. Fail: Staggers for 2 rounds. Each [THREAT] inflicts 2 strain. [DESPAIR]: Immobilizes for 2 rounds.

1 dose: Ignore effects of Easy/Average Critical Injury. 2 doses: Ignore effects of Hard Critical Injury. End Effects: Suffer Critical Injury, suffer [SETBACK][SETBACK] on all checks until end of session.
+1 Brawn until end of encounter. Upgrades difficulty of Agility-, Intellect-, and Cunning-related skills until end of session.
+1 Brawn until end of encounter. Upgrades difficulty of Agility-, Intellect-, and Cunning-related skills until end of session.
[AD][AD] for Agility- and Willpower-related checks until end of encounter. After, suffer [THREAT] to Brawn-. Intellect-. and Cunning-related checks until end of session.
Adds [BO][BO] to Charm or Negotiation checks made with Hutts. If rival clan, upgrade difficulty of Charm or Negotiation checks.
Trace route of currency protected by credit cleaner is a Formidable ([DI][DI][DI][DI][DI]) Computers check.
Slicing requires a Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Computers check. If unsuccessful, data is wiped and lost forever.

1 dose: Ignore effects of Easy/Average Critical Injury. 2 doses: Ignore effects of Hard Critical Injury. End Effects: Suffer Critical Injury, suffer [SETBACK][SETBACK] on all checks until end of session.
[AD][AD] for Agility- and Willpower-related checks until end of encounter. After, suffer [THREAT] to Brawn-. Intellect-. and Cunning-related checks until end of session.
Provides automatic [AD] on Negotiation and Streetwise checks to buy or sell items.
Reduces the difficulty of Perception or Vigilance checks to discover concealed items by two. Cannot scan an item with encumbrance higher than 10.
Reduces the difficulty of Perception or Vigilance checks to discover concealed items by two. Cannot scan an item with encumbrance higher than 100.
When coffer is in its wall niche, attempts to dicover it require a Formidable ([DI][DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check.
Locks require a Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Skulduggery check to pick.
Cracking requires specialized tools and a Formidable ([DI][DI][DI][DI][DI]) Skulduggery check.
Discerning identifiable features requires a Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check.
Fool fingerprint readers: Easy ([DI]) to Hard([DI][DI][DI) Cool or Deception checks. Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check to notice a worn fingerprint masque.
Require Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Computers check to recognize the credentials as fakes (or Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check without equipment).
When gambling, using a skifter gains [BO] to Skulduggery checks to cheat.
Make an Average ([DI][DI]) Computers check to increase the available encumbrance capacity of vehicle with silhouette 3+ by 10% (rounding up).
Upgrade the ability of any Agility-based checks until the end of the encounter. After encounter, suffer [SE] to any Agility-, Cunning-, or Intellect-based checks for the remainder of session.
Upgrade the ability of any Agility-based checks until the end of the encounter. After encounter, suffer [SE] to any Agility-, Cunning-, or Intellect-based checks for the remainder of session.
Add [BO] to all Cunning- and Presence-based checks until end of encounter.
Add [BO] to all Cunning- and Presence-based checks until end of encounter.

BaseMods.MiscDesc: Adds [BOOST][BOOST] to Vigilance checks
Grants [BOOST] to all Medicine skill checks, and [ADVANTAGE] to successful Medicine checks.

Adds [BOOST] to any attempt to locate the use of a data breaker in a computer system
Add automatic [AD][AD] to checks to establish identity.
Reduce check to resist poison by two (to a minimum of Easy ([DI]). Must make a Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Underworld check if poison is unknown.
Add [BO][BO] to checks to determine if documents are falsified.
Add [SE][SE] to Perception checks to find a concealed recorder on a person's body.
Add automatic [AD] to social checks with the manual's culture.
Requires Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check to find something hidden by a data dead drop.
Grants automatic [AD][AD] to all social checks involving foreign governments and access to individuals and services in those governments.
Add automatic [AD] to Charm and Deception checks.
Others add [BO] to checks to recall the wearer.
Gains automatic [AD] on any check to find a specific location or service within the region the guide covers.
Average ([DI][DI]) Ranged Light check to fire grappling hook up to medium range. Action to reel in cord.
Average ([DI][DI]) Athletics check to reel in himself and another character.
May contain a single dose of poison or other substance.
Can make a Skulduggery vs. Vigilance check to deposit contents into a meal or beverage without being noticed.
Make an Average ([DI][DI]) Computers check to discover presence and location of recording or espionage devices within medium range.
If recording or espionage device is hidden, make Computers vs. Mechanics check against the Mechanics skill of the hider.
Can conceal items up to half encumbrance of box.

Add [SE][SE] to checks to detect noise within short range of the sound dampener.
Add [BO][BO] to Xenology checks.
Adds [BOOST] to all Medicine, Survival, and Xenology skill checks made to analyze or treat large beasts.
Pacified beasts gain [BOOST] to any Displine Checks.
Owners gain [BOOST] and non-owners gain [SETBACK] on checks to maintain or repair any item.
Count the silhouette of target as one greater when making Gunnery checks against a starship or vehicle.
Downgrade difficulty of checks to maintain or repair vehicle or starship manual was written for.
When impersonating an individual voice, may upgrade Charm, Coercion, Deception, Leadership, and Negotiation checks once.
Allows access to hidden information in a droid's memory banks when linked.
When attempting to access information that a linked droid does not want revealed, Computer checks may be upgraded once.
Add [BO] to checks made to handle volatile materials or perform delicate work.
Wearer is not incapacitated by exceeding strain threshold. Instead, he also suffers one wound and becomes disoriented.
Allows underwater breathing for several weeks.

May upgrade Perception checks once. [AD] reveals fine details. [TR] can be spent to add a [BO] to all subsequent Perception checks for the encounter. [DE] adds [SE][SE] to checks, or makes some tings virtually impossible to see.
Adds [BO][BO] to any Athletics checks involving the enhanced leg. [DE] means the unit shorts out temporarily, dealing 5 strain damage.
Adds [BO][BO] to any Athletics checks involving the enhanced arm. [DE] means the unit shorts out temporarily, dealing 5 strain damage.
Gain [BO][BO][BO] to checks to resist bearsloth venom until end of encounter, or immediate remove on instance of Wracking Venom critical injury.
Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Resilience Check. Fail: Immediate critical injury - Wracking Venom - Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) When suffering wound or strain, suffer 2 more.
Adds automatic [AD] to build, modify, or repair lightsabers.
Breaking free requires a Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Athletics or Coordination check. [TH][TH] or [DE] suffers 4 strain, ignoring soak.
Adds [SE][SE][SE] to combat checks and other checks requiring sight.
Add [BO][BO] to Perception checks to find heat-emitting objects within short range.
Add [BO] to Mechanics checks to remove Critical Hits from starships and Critical Injuries from droids.
As an action, make Easy ([DI]) Medicine check to identify foreign elements (including poisons) in blood samples. Adds [AD][AD] to next Medicine check to treat patient.
Finding exact location within close planetary range requires an Average ([DI][DI]) Computers check. Increase difficulty by two for each additional range band, up to extreme.
Add [BO][BO] to checks to discern whether another character is lying or moitting significant information.
Add [BO][BO] to checks to ascertain another character's mental state.
As an action, may activate to fill an area out to short range with heavy fog. Fog lasts for three rounds (see page 219 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details on fog).
Expend 1 med-aid patch to add automatic [SU][AD] to Medicine check to heal wounds.
As an action, make an Easy ([DI]) Gunnery check to launch flare into air to provide light. Success illuminates out to long range. Failure illuminates ground to short range.
Breaking free requires a Formidable ([DI][DI][DI][DI][DI]) Athletics check.
Can only be installed on droids.
Can resist restraining bolts with an Easy ([DI]) Discipline check May spend [AD][AD] to overload restraining bolt, rendering it useless.
Once per session, a Force-sensitive character may make a Force power check. He may spend [FP][FP] to detect one threat the PC is likely going to encounter during the session.
A Force-sensitive character can consume a dose as a maneuver. The PC gains 10 Conflict and adds [DA][DA] to his next Force power check during that encounter.
Add [SE] on attempts to slice a system protected by a tracing console.
Adds [BOOST][BOOST] to Computers checks to defend a system protected by a tracing console, or to identify intruder (e.g., Trace User action).
A Force-sensitive character may add [FO] to all Force power or Force talent checks when dealing with creatures detailed in the Grimoire This effect lasts for the game session.
Until the end of the game session, a Force-sensitive character upgrades Fear checks while confronting creatures detailed in the Grimoire twice. Conflict due to a [DE] result is doubled.
Can only be installed on droids.
Counts as having slicer gear.
When droid is slicing or assisting in slicing, add [SE] to Computers checks to identify slicer (e.g., the Trace User action).
A Force-sensitive character heals 1 additional strain at the end of an encounter.
A Force-sensitive character heals 1 additional wound during natural rest.
Add [BO] to Medicine checks made to heal another character.
Removes [SE] imposed due to long range or poor light.
A Devaronian may inhale one dose as a maneuver, suffering 2 strain and adding [BO] to all Brawn and Agility checks until the end of the encounter.
Add [SE][SE] on attempts to acquire user's slicing signature (e.g., Trace User action).
Add [BO][BO] to Perception and Mechanics checks to scavenge parts or raw materials. Checks can be completed in half the time (or a quarter of the time with the Utinni! talent).
May recover supplies worth half of the Material Price from any failed crafting check.
A Force-sensitive character who wears the crown automatically fails all Deception checks and gains [SU][SU][SU] on checks to detect lies or to determine if someone is telling the truth.
Make an Easy ([DI]) Discipline check to recall any information experienced while recorder was running.
Can copy recordings to common types of external storage devices.
Counts as a tool kit.
Reduces time for repairs, crafting, or other Mechanics-related tasks by 50%.
To read a starchart correctly, make a Hard([DI][DI][DI]) Astrogation check with [SE][SE]. A [AD] on the check can be spent to determine if the chart is real.
A Force-sensitive character may reroll one [FO] when making checks involving piloting or using a starship or vehicle.
Commanders carrying a symbol add [BO] to social checks with other military personnel.
Droid brain: Brawn 5, Athletics 1 ([PR][AB][AB][AB][AB]).

Once per encounter as an action, may make an Average ([DI][DI]) Discipline check. If successful, may reactivate any overloaded cybernetic implants, such as from the Ion quality or similar effects, by suffering 2 strain per overloaded implant reactivated.
Cannot be overloaded by the Ion quality or similar effects.
Can hold a single object of 10 encumbrance or less aloft.
Removes [SE] from checks to repair hull trauma and Critical Hits on starships and vehicles.
A Force-sensitive character removes all [SE] imposed due to darkness, concealment, camouflage, or similar effects.
A Force-sensitive character can see in the dark as if in normal daylight.
When wearing a Cascader, upgrade all Charm, Deception, and Leadership checks by one.
A Force-sensitive character may perform one free Move maneuver per turn. This can allow a character to perform three maneuvers in one turn.
May be injected as a maneuver, increasing Willpower by 1 until the end of the encounter. Suffer 2 strain at the beginning of each subsequent turn.
Removes [SE][SE] from checks to remove system strain from starships and vehicles.
Cannot be installed on droids.
May only install a single biofeedback regulator.
Removes [SE] from checks made to intercept, interpret, or imitate Imperial communications.
Adds [BO] to Coercion checks targeting Imperial troops.
May recharge a depleted piece of equipment as a maneuver, or a droid or larger piece of machinery in an hour.
Engaged character may ignore "out of ammo"[DE] results in the same manner as an Extra Reload.
Can gather enough water each day to sustain one person. Batteries last six months.

Can only be used to use Medicine skill to attempt to remove Critical Injuries from others without penalty, but no other treatment options, as specified on page 232 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook.

Removes [SE] from Discipline, Perception, Resilience, or Vigilance checks to stay awake or notice something due to fatigue or lack of sleep until end of encounter. At end of encounter, target suffers 1 strain.

May apply to self or engaged character by making an Easy ([DI]) Medicine check and choosing one Easy ([DI]), Average ([DI][DI]), or Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Critical Injury on the target. If successful, target suffers 3 strain and ingores effect of Critical Injury until the end of the encounter.

Can detect radiation of silhouette 1 within short range, life forms within medium range, power sources within long range, and comms signals within extreme range. Increase range band by 1 for every silhouette size higher than 1.

Make a Hard([DI][DI][DI]) Computers check (Average([DI][DI]) if weapon is an Atgar SpaceDefense model) to link a single Gunnery weapon. If success, weapon gains Inaccurate 2 and holder can fire the linked weapon via remote from up to medium range.
Transmits up to medium range on planetary scale.
Add [SE][SE][SE] to any attempt to intercept and unscramble its signal.
Transmits up to medium range on planetary scale.
Add [SE] to any check made to intercept and unscramble its signal.
Add [BO][BO] to Knowledge checks related to current events or conditions at the GM's discretion.
Adds [BO][BO] to Fear checks caused by Imperial operatives to himself and all allies within short range.
Removes [SE][SE] to checks to resist hostile temperatures while sleeping in tent, and downgrades difficulty of such checks once.
Reduces difficulty to climb by 2, to minimum of 0.
May attach to cargo to reduce encumbrance by 7.
May sustain a character for a week to ten days with rationing.
Use on unaware target with opposed Skulduggery vs. Resilience check. Success incapacitates a minion or deals 12 strain to rival or nemesis. Each [SU] adds 1 damage.

Bypasses simple locks within 5 minutes. May attempt Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Skulduggery check to speed up process. Each [SU] reduces time by one minute. Failure triggers alerm. Force users may add power check, adding [SU] or [AD] for each [FP] generated.
Listening to a conversation protected by curtain requires a Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Perception check to understand anything said. [TH] or [DE] may be spent to misunderstand key words or phrases.
Planting this device unnoticed requires an opposed Skulduggery vs. Vigilance check. Once planted, requires a Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Vigilance check to locate.
Can see through up to two meters of wall. Dense or shielded materials impose at least [SE] to Perception checks (GM's discretion).
User may see in low light or extreme bright light conditions.
Magnifies targetets up to 10 kilometers away.
User may remove [SE] imposed due to long range or low light.
Can see through up to two meters of wall. Dense or shielded materials impose at least [SE] to Perception checks (GM's discretion).
For one encounter, whenever user suffers involuntary strain, suffer 3 less strain (minimum 1). Force user adds [FO] to power checks, but doubles strain and Conflict for using [DA].
For one encounter, whenever user suffers involuntary strain, suffer 3 less strain (minimum 1). Force user adds [FO] to power checks, but doubles strain and Conflict for using [DA].
Five minute delay. Victim upgrades the difficulty of all checks to withold information or resist manipulation (including Force powers) once for next 24 hours.
Five minute delay. Victim upgrades the difficulty of all checks to withold information or resist manipulation (including Force powers) once for next 24 hours.

For non-Force users, removes [SE][SE][SE] added to checks from pain or illness for 12 hours and imposes [TH] to all checks for 24 hours. Force users receive both effects for twice the duration, but suffer -1 to Force Rating while active.

For non-Force users, removes [SE][SE][SE] added to checks from pain or illness for 12 hours and imposes [TH] to all checks for 24 hours. Force users receive both effects for twice the duration, but suffer -1 to Force Rating while active.

BaseMods.MiscDesc: When making a Knowledge (Lore) check to learn about the Jedi, the PCs may use the holocron to make an assisted check. The holocron counts as having three ranks in Knowledge (Lore).

Name: P2F Hostile Environment Remote
AdvImportPath: Disciples of Harmony\Droids\P2F Hostile Environment Remote - Minion.xml

Name: ED-V8-Series Envoy Droid
AdvImportPath: Disciples of Harmony\Droids\ED-V8-Series Envoy Droid - Rival.xml

Name: SBD-Series Assistance and Rescue Droid
AdvImportPath: Disciples of Harmony\Droids\SBD-Series Assistance and Rescue Droid - Rival.xml

Name: TTS20-Series Dialectic Droid
AdvImportPath: Disciples of Harmony\Droids\TTS20-Series Dialectic Droid - Rival.xml

BaseMods.MiscDesc: Removes [SE] from checks due to temperatures outside the wearer's perferred environment.
May add [SU] to checks of a particular Knowledge skill selected before an encounter.
Adds [BO][BO] to Perception, Knowledge (Lore), or Knowledge (Education) checks requiring magnification of fine details.
Adds [BO] to Perception, Knowledge (Lore), or Knowledge (Education) checks for studying subterranean environments within medium range.
Adds [BO][BO] to any Perception or Vigilance checks to detect a bug within short range.
Removes [SE][SE] from the first Charm, Coercion, or Negotiation check made during an encounter.
Removes [SE][SE] from Char, Coercion, or Negotiation checks that are added due to linguistic difficulties.
Difficulty of Medicine check to heal Critical Injury of user reduced by one, to minimum of Easy ([DI]).

Must be pre-configured for a single skill. Character makes a Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Discipline check. If successful, character counts as having rank 3 in that skill for rest of session. Failure means strain is halved for rest of session.
Add automatic [SU] to Medicine check to heal a Critical Injury.
Removes up to [SE][SE] from Medicine checks made by the user.
Apply cast to limb crippled or disabled by a Critical Injury with an Easy ([DI]) Medicine check. If successfuly, Critical Injury is healed in one week.
Foamcast adds [BO] to checks to repair structures and vehicle hulls.
GM may spend [TH] on checks to repair structures and vehicle hulls to have the foamcast can be depleted.
A can of foamcast can be made into an improvised explosive.

Mod.MiscDesc: [DE] on the Mechanics check means the can ruptures and covers user in foamcast.

BaseMods.MiscDesc: May lift up to silhouette 4 vehicle up to 2 meters off the ground.
To move or rotate, make an Athletics check with a difficulty equal to the silhouette.
Counts as a tool kit.
Once per encounter, tool may be drawn as an incidental.
Locating concealed mine requires a Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Computers or Average ([DI][DI]) Vigilance check. If successful, all mines and explosives within medium range are revealed.
Using requires an Average ([DI][DI]) Computers check. If successfuly, can see through walls and bulkheads up to short range until end of encounter.
Removes [SE] from checks to remove system strain from a vehicle.
Adds [BO][BO] to Perception checks when determining locations on a planet's surface, measuring distances, plotting settlements or bases, and creating maps.
Adds [AD] to Mechanics checks.
May be used as a weapon.
Counts as a tool kit when dealing with explosives.
May spend [AD][AD][AD][AD] on a check to remove one rolled [DE].
Adds [BO][BO] to any check made to build or demolish structures.
May be used as a weapon.
As a maneuver, generator may be used to recharge an item or energy weapon in same manner as extra reloads.
Adds automatic [AD][AD] on checks to detect, disarm, or neutralize explosive compounds and devices.
Counts as a tool kit.
Reduces time required for repairs, crafting, and other Mechanics-related tasks by 5.
Adds [BO][BO] on checks to clear land, build structures, set up obstacles, set or disarm explosives, or other engineering tasks in the field.
Gain automatic [SU] on checks to build structures.
Requires two hands to use.
Adds [BO] to checks involving breaking rocks, ground clearing, and similar activities.
Can be used as a weapon.

Name: BT-Series Ordnance Droid
AdvImportPath: Fully Operational\Droids\BT-Series Ordnance Droid - Rival.xml

Name: EG-6 Power Droid
AdvImportPath: Fully Operational\Droids\EG-6 Power Droid - Minion.xml

Name: EOD-Mk IV Explosives Disposal Remote
AdvImportPath: Fully Operational\Droids\EOD-Mk IV Explosives Disposal Remote - Minion.xml

Name: GT-Series Construction Droid
AdvImportPath: Fully Operational\Droids\GT-Series Construction Droid - Rival.xml

Name: RH-Series Research Droid
AdvImportPath: Fully Operational\Droids\RH-Series Research Droid - Rival.xml

BaseMods.MiscDesc: Silhouette: 3.
Soak: 15.
Wound Threshold: 10
If attacked, [TH][TH] or [DE] may be spent to inflict half of the damage it suffers onto a ship to which it has been attached.

Can be removed with a unique key code created when the lock is installed, but it can be dismantled in a laborious process requiring an upgraded Formidable ([CH][CH][DI][DI][DI]) Mechanics check and eight hours of hard work. If the character has direct knowledge of a gravity lock’s inner workings, they check is not upgraded and the process takes half the time.

One dose of Skirtopanol requires a Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Resilience check to overcome. On a failed check, the drug inflicts 5 strain, and the difficulty of all checks the target makes to resist Charm or Coercion for the remainder of the encounter is upgraded once. In addition, each [TH] generated on the original check inflicts 2 strain on the target. Finally, the GM can spend [DE] to make the target check against the drug again during the next round, as it remains in his system.

A single dose of vue lasts for twenty-four hours. During that time, the character upgrades the ability of any checks made to resist stress or fear once. In addition, the difficulty of Ranged (Light) and Ranged (Heavy) checks made at long or extreme range is reduced by one.
At the Game Master's discretion, frequent use of vue can cause impaired judgement and loss of memory, imposing permanent [SE] on Intellect- and Cunning-based checks.

Cortex bombs detonate when the implanted individual speaks, hears, or sees a predetermined code word or signal, and kill only the wearer. They deal very little discernible damage to the target, though, and no damage to the surrounding area.
A cyber disguise gives a character all the advantages of a standard disguise kit.
Changing general features—for example, changing eye color, altering hair color, or growing a beard—takes one to three rounds. More involved disguises can take minutes or hours to perfect.
To take on the appearance of a specific individual, a cyber disguise user must make a thorough study of the subject, then make a Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Deception check to set the disguise.

A cyber disguise cannot change a being's general shape or size, add or subtract limbs, or allow an individual to impersonate a member of another species. At the Game Master's discretion, a cyber disguise could be used to impersonate species that are very similar to the user's; a human could impersonate a Chiss or Pantoran, for example.
A multi-tool hand provides all the benefits of a tool kit.

The exact specifications of an agent bag vary by agency and agent, and are left to the Game Master's discretion. The Gear Attachments section, on page 58 of Cyphers and Masks, has many possible items for inclusion in a customized agent's bag, and players and GMs are encouraged to create new attachments as well.
The gear hidden in a concealed escape kit upgrades the ability of all Mechanics and Skulduggery checks made to escape confinement once.
The laser cutter works for a single round before its energy cell burns out, which is usually just enough time to destroy a mechanical lock or cut a metal bar out of a window or cell door.
The flexible monoknife included in the kit has the following profile: (Melee; Damage + 1; Critical 3; Range (Engaged); Pierce 1).
Upgrade the difficulty of checks to detect a concealed escape kit twice.
Setting the explosive charge hidden in the belt requires an Average ([DI][DI]) Mechanics check.
The charge detonates with the following profile: (Damage 15; Critical 3; Range (Engaged); Blast 5, Breach 1, Limited Ammo 1).
Upgrade the difficulty of checks to detect the belt's true nature twice.
Once per round, a character with a dataspike may expend it to attempt to disable a security program as a maneuver (rather than as an action).
Reduce the difficulty of the Computers check to disable the program by 2, to a minimum of Simple (-).
After one use, the dataspike burns out and becomes useless.

Name: Chameleon Droid
AdvImportPath: Nexus of Power\Adversaries\Droids\Chameleon Droid - Rival.xml

Name: Stone Guardian
AdvImportPath: Nexus of Power\Adversaries\Droids\Stone Guardian - Rival.xml

BaseMods.MiscDesc: A Force-sensitive may spend a maneuver to inhale Ashes of Malachor. They gain 5 Conflict and may add [SU][TH] to all attacks until end of encounter.
Once per session as an action, a Force-sensitive may use calming salve to make a Force power check. [FP] generated from [LI] may be used to recover one strain per [FP].
Must spend at least 1 hour and pass a Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Discipline check. If fail, heal 2 strain. If pass, receive a vision. Once solved, must obtain a new set of rings.
May use cube during a skill check. If at least 1 uncanceled [AD], add [SU] and [LI]. If at least 1 uncanceled [TH], add [FA] and [DA].
For next 24 hours after 1 hour medication, may suffer 2 strain to add [FP] to next Alter or Battle Medication Force power check.
This item provides the wearer with a retractable garrote hidden within a standard chrono.
Upgrade the difficulty of checks to detect the concealed garrote twice.
Slicewire comes in small spools containing ten meters of wire.
When used as a weapon, slicewire has the following profile: (Brawl; Damage +2; Critical 2; Range (Engaged); Pierce 2, Vicious 3).
If a user fails a Brawl check when using this weapon, the Game Master can spend [TH][TH][TH] or [DE] to inflict the weapon's full damage onto the user.

Name: ASP-19 Battle Droid
AdvImportPath: Knights of Fate\Droids\ASP-19 Battle Droid - Nemesis.xml

Name: SR-Series Scout/Observation Droid
AdvImportPath: Knights of Fate\Droids\SR-Series Scout_Observation Droid - Rival.xml

BaseMods.MiscDesc: Add [SE] to all Brawn- and Agility-based skill checks and to all combat checks
If weights are worn through a game session, increase amount of XP by 1

Name: WSW Mk III "Harrier"Combat Remote
AdvImportPath: Knights of Fate\Droids\WSW Mk III _Harrier_ Combat Remote - Minion.xml

BaseMods.MiscDesc: A Jedi utility belt contains a three-day supply of food capsules, an emergency medpac, a lightsaber maintenance kit, a slim glow rod, a comlink, and an aquata breather. A number of empty pouches are concealed along the belt's interior side, allowing the wearer to hide small items. In addition, a standard lightsaber can be securely hung from the belt for easy access.
Adds automatic [AD] to build, modify, or repair lightsabers.

Name: AC1-Series Surveillance Droid
AdvImportPath: Cyphers and Masks\Droids\AC1-Series Surveillance Droid - Minion.xml

BaseMods.MiscDesc: Upgraded Daunting ([CH][DI][DI][DI]) Resilience check. Fail: 10 wound and Critical Injury +40 per [TH]. [TH][TH][TH] or [DE] may kill instantly.
Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Resilience check. Fail: 2 wound and 2 strain immediately, plus 1 wound and strain daily for 10 days. +1 wound and +1 strain daily per [TH]. Each [DE] increases days by 1.

Name: E522 Assassin Droid
AdvImportPath: Cyphers and Masks\Droids\E522 Assassin Droid - Nemesis.xml

BaseMods.MiscDesc: Noticing an individual is wearing an earbud comlink requires a Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Perception check.

Detecting an HID requires a Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check. Droids or anyone using any technological optical device (scanner, electrobinoculars, etc.) require an Average ([DI][DI]) Perception check.
Adds [BO] to Skulduggery and Computers checks made to defeat locks.

Name: LSx-Series Slicer Droid
AdvImportPath: Cyphers and Masks\Droids\LSX-Series Slicer Droid - Rival.xml

Name: M4-Series Messenger Droid
AdvImportPath: Cyphers and Masks\Droids\M4-Series Messenger Droid - Rival.xml

BaseMods.MiscDesc: Upgrades all checks to resist pain or physical torture once.

Name: Q-Signal Messenger Drone
AdvImportPath: Cyphers and Masks\Droids\Q-Signal Messenger Drone - Rival.xml

Name: RA-7 Protocol Droid
AdvImportPath: Cyphers and Masks\Droids\RA-7 Protocol Droid - Rival.xml

Name: RM-Series Military Intelligence Droid
AdvImportPath: Cyphers and Masks\Droids\RM-Series Military Intelligence Droid - Nemesis.xml

BaseMods.MiscDesc: Programming retinal pattern requires an Average ([DI][DI]) Perception check.
Retina scanners require an Easy ([DI]) to Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Cool or Deception check to fool. Suspicious scanner operator may requires an opposed Deception vs. Computers check.
Has a range of close on the planetary scale, or long on the personal scale.
Upgrades the ability of any check to locate bugs, hidden cameras, data streams, or engage in any other counter-surveillance activities, once.

Name: TS-Series Interrogation Droid
AdvImportPath: Cyphers and Masks\Droids\TS-Series Interrogation Droid - Rival.xml

BaseMods.MiscDesc: Finding a vessel implant on a character requires a Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check.
Requires a Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check to overhear conversation within the area of effect.
Using a recording device within the area of affect requires a Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Computers check, but recording is still incomplete. Cannot record at all outside area of affect.
Changing natural voice takes 1 round.
Mimicking the voice of a specific individual requires thorough study and a Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Deception check.
Counts as a tool kit for opening mechanical and simple electrical locks.

Provides 6 hours of atmosphere to an air breather. During this time, the wearer also has access to fresh water, nutrition supplements, and other biological necessities. While wearing an aquasuit, the wearer does not suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

Add [SE][SE][SE] to a character's Perception check to notice nano-droids, unless the searcher knows to look for them and has an appropriate scanner. Nano-droids can be reprogrammed to explode. When activated, they deal 20 damage with the Breach 1 item quality to everything within Short range, including the object in which they are contained.

Dressed for Success: Once per session, the owner of Land o's armoire may make a Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Perception check to select a flattering cape. If successful, they can upgrade one Charm check they make during the next encounter while wearing the selected cape. The wearer may spend [AD][AD][AD] or [TR] from the Perception check to upgrade all Charm checks they make during the encounter once. instead. See Table 9-1 : Lando's Armoire for a list of some of the capes PC'-s' might find on their travels. A GM may choose to roll a d100 to randomly determine what cape is discovered.
Once per encounter. the wearer may upgrade the difficulty of a Deception check they make once to add automatic [TR] to the result.
Once per encounter during a Negotiation check. the wearer may remove [DE] from the results and add [TH][TH] instead
Once per encounter. the wearer may add [SU][AD] to the results of a Leadership check.
Adds [SE][SE] to all checks made to detect concealed items on the wearer's person.
Increases soak by 1 and decreases Critical Injury results Inflicted on the wearer by 10 to a minimum of 1 . [I]Soak increase handled through enduring talent
Adds [BO][BO] to all Charm checks the wearer makes.

Prepared to Lead: Once per session, the owner of Leia Organa's Diplomatic Wardrobe may make a Hard [DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge or Perception check to curate an outfit. If successful, select one social skill and add [BO] to all checks the wearer makes during the next encounter. The wearer may spend [AD][AD] to increase the bonus to [BO][BO], or may spend [TR] to select one additional social skill. See Table 9- 2: Leia Organa's Diplomatic Wardrobe on page 134 of Gadgets and Gear for a selection of Leia's outfits PCs' might find on their travels. A GM may choose to roll a d100 to randomly determine what outfit is discovered.
Adds [SU][SU] to social skill checks made to affect citizens of Alderaan. If hood is raised, adds [SE][SE] to any Perception or Vigilance checks made to identify the wearer.
The wearer upgrades the ability of any Charm checks and checks to use the Inspiring Rhetoric talent once.
The wearer adds [BO] to social skill checks made to use a talent that affects an ally. The wearer also downgrades the difficulty of any Resilience checks they make to resist cold once.
The wearer adds [SU][AD] to the results of Negotiation checks they make.

In forest and tropical rainforest environments, the wearer adds [BO][BO] to Stealth checks and adds [SE][SE] to Perception and Vigilance checks made to locate or notice wearer. The wearer also increases their ranged and melee defense by 1 while in those environments.
Setup requires an Easy ([DI]) Mechanics check and takes 5 minutes. Disabling safeties takes half the time, but increases difficulty to Hard ([DI][DI][DI]).
GM may spend [TH][TH][TH] or [DE] on check with disabled safeties to cause premature detomation.

Mod.MiscDesc: Setup requires an Easy ([DI]) Mechanics check and takes 5 minutes. Disabling safeties takes half the time, but increases difficulty to Hard ([DI][DI][DI]).
GM may spend [TH][TH][TH] or [DE] on check with disabled safeties to cause premature detomation.
Each additional charge increases base damage by 5.

BaseMods.MiscDesc: Adds [BO] to Presence-based checks to address a crowd.
Allows the user's image and voice to be clearly seen and heard up to extreme range.
Adds [BO] to all checks made to impress or persuade other characters based on their past service. Having an exceptional number of insignia may add an additional [BO].
Adds [BO] to all checks made to impress or persuade other characters based on their past service. Having an exceptional number of insignia may add an additional [BO].
A Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Perception check reveals the replica to be a fake.
Adds [SU] to all checks involving formal Republic proceedings, proof of identity, or verification of past actions.
Gains [BO][BO] on Mechanics checks to prepare, set, or disarm explosives.
Once per session, a character using an XSR kit may remove one [DE] or up to [TH][TH][TH] from a Mechanics check dealing with explosives.
